common_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Temperature above threshold, cpu clock throttled
common_error_warning_patterns.advice: Test caused CPU temperature above critical threshold. Insufficient cooling?
common_error_warning_patterns.label: CommonThermalOverrun

common_error_warning_patterns.advice: The boot processor is not enumerated!
common_error_warning_patterns.label: CommonBiosBootCpuNotEnumerated

common_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Wrong _BBN value, reboot and use option 'pci=noacpi'
common_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS has wrong _BBN value, which will make PCI root bridge have wrong bus number
common_error_warning_patterns.label: CommonAcpiWrongBbnValue

common_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI.*apic on CPU.* stops in C2
common_error_warning_patterns.advice: The local apic timer incorrectly stops during C2 idle state.The ACPI specification forbids this and Linux needs the local APIC timer to work. The most likely cause of this is that the firmware uses a hardware C3 or C4 state that is mapped to the ACPI C2 state.
common_error_warning_patterns.label: CommonAcpiApicStopsInC2

common_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel detected an irq storm. This is most probably an IRQ routing bug.
common_error_warning_patterns.label: CommonBiosIrqRoutingBug

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Invalid type .* for target of Scope operator .*Cannot override
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter found an invalid type for target of a scope operator, this occurred during the loading of the ACPI tables, see acpi_ds_load2_begin_op().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidTypeScopeOp

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter detected a zero divisor which produce a division by zero error.  The AML code is buggy and this will return an undefined value that may cause unexpected behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmlDivideByZero

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not release AML Interpreter mutex
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI AML interpreter attempted to release the mutex but this failed. The next time interpreter will attempt to acquire this mutex it will fail, however it will continue to execute AML but there will be race conditions occurring.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmlMutexNotReleased

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not map memory at 0x.* for length
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI could not memory map the Extended BIOS Data Area (EBDA) or upper region 0xE0000-0xFFFFF to search for the ACPI RSDP.  This normally results in the RSDP not being found, which means the ACPI tables can't be located and hence ACPI is disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRsdpMemMap

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A zero thread ID was returned which will break the ACPI driver.  This should never happen, since the thread ID is actually the address of the thread descriptor which is never zero.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiZeroThreadId

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI engine was expecting to increment, decrement or delete a reference count but instead was given an uknown action to do instead.  This is a bug in the ACPI ACPICA code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRefCountUnknownAction

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter found a NULL parse opcode and didn't expect to. See acpi_ds_delete_result_if_not_used() or acpi_ds_is_result_used().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNullOp

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter found an AML opcode that had an unexpected parent class. This probably indicates an internal ACPI interpeter bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownParentOp

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI Stall() op was requested to wait for more than 255 usec.  The ACPI specification states that the maximum should be 100 usec but to accommodate some firmware a maximum of 255 is supported by the kernel.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiStallTooLarge

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Could not set the brightness level, the ACPI control _BCM failed to execute correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBcmFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI video driver set the brightness level using the ACPI control _BCM, however the level used was not a known level (as returned by _BCL).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidBrightness

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI method _BCL (Query List of Brightness Control Levels Supported) contains too many duplicated brightness levels in the returned package and this is non-standard.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBclPackageContainsDuplicates

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI method _BCL (Query List of Brightness Control Levels Supported) has a maximum brightness value which is not the last value in the returned package. Values returned must be in ascending order.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBclUnorderedPackage

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A request to terminate the ACPI driver but it is already terminated. You should not see this error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAlreadyTerminated

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to push the current scope onto the scope stack, the node was Null, which was not expected. See acpi_ds_scope_stack_push().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNullScopeParameter

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver could not convert an AML resource descriptor to a corresponding internal resource descriptor. Refer to acpi_rs_convert_aml_to_resource() or acpi_rs_convert_resource_to_aml().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiConversionSupOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver could not convert an AML resource descriptor to a corresponding internal resource descriptor. Refer to acpi_rs_convert_aml_to_resource() or acpi_rs_convert_resource_to_aml().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiConversionSupOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No SMI_CMD in FADT, mode transition failed
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI FADT SMI_CMD is zero, with ACPI 2.0 this means that the system cannot transtion to/from ACPI mode.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFadtSmiCmdZero

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No ACPI mode transition supported in this system (enable/disable both zero)
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI FADT ACPI_ENABLE is zero and ACPI_DISABLE is set, ACPI 2.0 this means enabling or disabling is not supported and the system cannot transition to ACPI mode.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNoModeTransitionSupport

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occured in the ACPI driver, acpi_ns_delete_children() was trying to delete children objects and discovered that one of these had children objects of it's own, which should not happen.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjectGrandchild

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot assign type .* to .*must be type Int/Str/Buf
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: Type assignment was illegal, acpi_ex_resolve_object() was trying assign a type to a different type which is illegal.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTypeAssign

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Store into an unresolved Alias object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: The ACPI driver has been asked to resolve an object of type ACPI_TYPE_LOCAL_ALIAS or ACPI_TYPE_LOCAL_METHOD_ALIAS but this should not occur as these should have been resolved earlier. See function acpi_ex_resolve_object() for more details.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnresolveAliasObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: The ACPI interpreter has reached an opcode that is unknown, this normally is a bug in the underlying AML code either because of badly written AML code or the compiler has produced code that is incorrect or the ACPI interpreter does not support this valid opcode.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownAmlOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: The ACPI interpreter has reached an opcode that is unknown, this normally is a bug in the underlying AML code either because of badly written AML code or the compiler has produced code that is incorrect or the ACPI interpreter does not support this valid opcode.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownAmlOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Found unknown opcode .* at AML address .* offset
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: The ACPI interpreter has reached an opcode that is unknown, this normally is a bug in the underlying AML code either because of badly written AML code or the compiler has produced code that is incorrect or the ACPI interpreter does not support this valid opcode.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownAmlOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: AML opcode AML_FROM_BCD_OP (0x5b28) contains a BCD digit value that is greater than 9 and is out of range for a Binary Coded Decimal digit.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBcdDigitTooLarge

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Integer too large to convert to BCD
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: AML opcode AML_TO_BCD_OP (0x5b29) has been requested to convert an integer into a Binary Coded Decimal value that is too large. An overflow has been caught and it is possible that unexpected execution behaviour will occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiToBcdOverflow

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: Execution of AML_SHIFT_LEFT_BIT_OP (0x5b11) or AML_SHIFT_RIGHT_BIT_OP (0x5b10) were ignored, these are obsolete AML opcodes and are not implemented in the ACPI interpreter. Unexepcted execution behaviour will occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOpObsolete

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Operand must be Buffer/Integer/String/Package - found type
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: Execution of AML_SIZE_OF_OP with an operand that is not a buffer, integer, string or package has occurred. This will result in unexpected behaviour. This is a bug in the AML.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOpTypeBad

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: Execution of AML_DEREF_OF_OP (0x83) with an illegal target index operator that was not a buffer or a package type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownIndexTargetType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution run time error: Execution of AML_DEREF_OF_OP (0x83) with an illegal operand reference class.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownIndexTargetType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: More then 20 APM events were queued up which is unexpected.  The queue was not being drained quickly by a reading process (perhaps it is not running).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogApmEventQueueOverflow

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A read of the APM events was performed by a reading process with an unrecognised file pointer. This should not happen.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogApmReadBadFileptr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to release a APM reader occurred using an unrecognised file pointer. This should not happen.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogApmReleaseBadFileptr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: apm.*cannot allocate struct of size %d bytes
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to open failed, out of memory. APM events cannot be read.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogApmOpenNoMemory

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: apm.*disabled - Unable to start kernel thread
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Cannot start kernel APM thread, APM handling will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogApmKernelThreadFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PnPBIOS.*ESCD size reported by BIOS escd_info call is too great
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ESCD size was greater than a sane size of 32K.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPnpBiosEscdSize

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PnPBIOS.*ESCD size reported by BIOS read_escd call is too great
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ESCD size was greater than a sane size of 32K.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPnpBiosEscdSize

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The PnPBIOS driver has detected an issue that fwts does not know about.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPnpBiosError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Node number .* is out of sequence following node .* Aborting.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Device node numbers are out of sequence.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPnpBiosDevNodeSeqError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A call to the PCI BIOS32 service routine (with service signature $PCI) has returned a bad status or an illegal PCI signature. The kernel will disable the use of the PCI BIOS.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBios32PciFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Legacy E820 BIOS has a limit of 128 entries in the E820 memory map but the firmware seems to have more than this. For EFI Numa hardare, the limit is 128 + 3 * maximum number of nodes.  The kernel has ignore the extra entries.  This could lead to regions of memory being used by the kernel when in fact is should be reserved and this can lead to unexpected behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogE820TooManyEntries

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Ooops! Too many entries in the memory map!
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Legacy E820 BIOS has a limit of 128 entries in the E820 memory map but the firmware seems to have more than this. For EFI Numa hardare, the limit is 128 + 3 * maximum number of nodes.  The kernel has ignore the extra entries.  This could lead to regions of memory being used by the kernel when in fact is should be reserved and this can lead to unexpected behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogE820TooManyEntries

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: MTRR.*CPU.*SYSCFG.*MtrrFixDramModEn.*not cleared by BIOS, clearing this bit
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The firmware is expected to clear MtrrFixDramModEn bit, see for example BIOS and Kernel Developer's Guide for the AMD Athlon 64 and AMD Opteron Processors (26094 Rev. 3.30 February 2006), section 13.2.1.2 SYSCFG Register. The MtrrFixDramModEn bit should be set 1 during firmware initalization of the fixed MTRRs, then cleared to 0 for operation. Hence the kernel has detected and worked around this fault.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogMtrrFixDramModEnNotClear

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Writing to a MTRR MSR has failed. The kernel cannot do much about this and has ignored the failure.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogMtrrWriteMsrFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to request an interrupt vector greater than 256 (ACPI_MAX_PLATFORM_INTERRUPTS) has occurred and will be rejected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIa64RequestBadVector

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Could not find the ACPI MADT. The kernel could not find this table so it could determine how many CPUs the system had.  The machine will boot with just one CPU which may be the incorrect number of CPUs.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtMissing

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI.*Error parsing MADT - no LAPIC entries
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI MADT could not be parsed to determine the number of Local APIC entries.  This may lead to sub-optimal configuration of the machine.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtLapicParseError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI.*Error parsing LAPIC address override entry
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI MADT could not be parsed to determine the Local APIC override entry.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtLapiceOverrideParseError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI MADT could not be parsed to determine the Local APIC NMI entry.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtLapicNmiParseError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI MADT could not be parsed to find the IOSAPIC entries.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtIosapicParseError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI.*Error parsing platform interrupt source entry
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI MADT could not be parsed to find the platform intrerrupt source entry.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtPlatIntSrcParseError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Fixed ACPI Description Table (FADT) is missing and so the kernel cannot determine if the legacy keyboard controller is present.  It cannot also determine the SCI_INT interrupt line which is used for ACPI events, such as the power and sleep buttons. If the SCI_INT is not on a legacy interrupt then it needs to be specified in the FADT.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFadtMissing

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to create an entry in /proc/acpi but failed. This should not happen and is a kernel bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiProcfsCreateFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to create a sysfs link for a device and this failed. This should not happen and is a kernel bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSysfsLinkCreateFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to update the fan power state when coming out of resume. The call to acpi_bus_update_power() failed even though the fan device was valid.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFanResumeUpdate

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A request to suspend the machine was aborted because it was asked to transition to a sleep state that is not supported by the ACPI driver or this machine.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnsupportedSleepState

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Hardware changed while hibernated, cannot resume
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The FACS hardware signature has changed when coming out of hibernation. The kernel has concluded that the machine has changed and therefore won't commit to resuming from hibernate.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiS4ResumeBadFacsSignature

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A processor hotplug notify eject request event was rejected because the device does not seem to exist.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotPlugEjectMissingDevice

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Driver data is NULL, dropping EJECT
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A processor hotplug notify eject request event was rejected because the device data is NULL.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotplugEjectNullDeviceData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The IOAPIC pin was invalid, it exceeded the maximum expected pin reference value (MP_MAX_IOAPIC_PIN 127).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIoApicPinRefInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to parse the ACPI MADT, the number of IOAPIC entries found was less than zero, which probably means the MADT is broken.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtParseError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI MADT was expected to contain at least one IOAPIC entry, however, none were found. Cannot enumerate the IOAPICs.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtNoIoApicEntry

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Error parsing interrupt source overrides entry
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Could not parse the ACPI MADT to determine the interrupt override for the SCI. This could lead to unexpected behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtIrqOverrideParseError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Could not parse the ACPI MADT to determine the NMI SRC entry. This could lead to unexpected behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtNmiSrcEntryParseError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A PCI slot could not be register because a call to pci_create_slot() failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciSlot

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Traversing the PCI root bridge failed because of an error walking the P2P bridge.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciSlot

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Adding a PCI slot failed because traversing the PCI root bridge failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciSlot

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI _PRS resource type was expected to be an IRQ type and was not.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkPrsIrq

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI _CRS resource type was expected to be an IRQ type and was not.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkCrsIrq

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A query of _STA to get the bus status failed and the current link status is unknown.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkSta

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The query of the bus status failed because the _CRS controlled returned IRQ 0, which was not expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkCrsIrqZero

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A PCI link set failed because the link IRQ resource type is invalid.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkIrqResourceInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to enabled the link device failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Unable to allocate an IRQ failed because the link device is invalid.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkDeviceInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Unable to allocate an IRQ failed because the link context was invalid (NULL).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkContextNull

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Support for multiple index IRQ entries per link device is not yet implemented.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkMultipleIrqEntries

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Unable to allocate an IRQ failed because the active IRQ is 0, which is wrong.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkActiveIrqZero

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to free the IRQ of a link failed because the link was not initialized.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkNotInitialized

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred evaluating the ACPI Processor() object, ACPI CPU control for this CPU broken.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiProcessorFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred evaluating an ACPI CPU _UID, ACPI CPU control for this CPU is broken.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiProcessorBadUid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Processor Register Block data is not the expected size, ACPI control of this CPU will not occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiProcessorPblkBad

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to get ACPI performance states from the _PSS contol, buffer was either NULL or not an ACPI package.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPssFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Invalid BIOS _PSS frequency found for processor
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: CPU frequency in MHz as supplied by _PSS control cannot be stored in a 32 bit unsigned integer, overflow error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPssFreqTooBig

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No valid BIOS _PSS frequency found for processor
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: One of the CPUs did not have a valid _PSS frequency defined. Cannot fetch _PSS levels for this CPU.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPssNotFound

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI _PSD control returned a pointer that was NULL or not an ACPI package or did not have 1 item in the package or the item could not be fetched out of the package. P-State dependencies cannot be evaluated, machine may perform sub-optimally.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPsdBadData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The number of _PSD entries should be 5 but a different count was returned. The P-State dependencies cannot be evaluated, machine may perform sub-optimally.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPsdBadCount

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _PSD revision should be 0 but a different version was returned. P-State dependencies cannot be evaluated, machine may perform sub-optimally.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPsdBadRevision

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _PSD coordination type was invalid, it should be SW_ALL, SW_ANY or HW_ALL. P-State dependencies cannot be evaluated, machine may perform sub-optimally.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPsdBadCoordType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI video brightness for the LCD could not be set because _BCM failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiVideoBcmFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI _DOD control returned an element that was not an ACPI integer as expected. This element will be ignored, which could lead to reduced functionality.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiVideoDodFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI _DDC control is returning either a NULL buffer pointer or data that is not an ACPI buffer. The Extended Display Identification Data (EDID) structure that represents the display output device could not be fetched. This may affect video output.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiVideoDdcFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI _BCL control is returning either a NULL buffer pointer or data that is not an ACPI package. LCD brightness level queries will not work.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiVideoBclFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to unbind a device, the ACPI handle was corrupt.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHandleCorrupt

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Cannot add the ACPI platform notifiers, they are already registered. This should not happen.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPlatformNotify

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Adding a hotplug memory device failed because.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotPlugAddMemDeviceFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI notify eject request occurred to disable a memory device.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotPlugNotifyDisableOkay

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI notify eject request failed because the device data is NULL.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotPlugNotifyEjectDataNull

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI notify eject request failed because the device does not exist.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotPlugNotifyEjectDeviceNotExist

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Memory device notify failed because it could not enabled the memory device.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotPlugEnableFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Memory device notify failed because it could not find the relevant driver data for this device.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotPlugDeviceNotify

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to add memory device, add_memory() failed for some reason.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotPlugAddMemoryFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The devices resources could not be determined from the relevant ACPI _CRS control and so the memory device could not be enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotPlugCrsFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI AML fatal opcode was executed and the kernel has trapped this signal. It could be because of faulty control method code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFatalOpcodeSignal

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to queue up AML exec work on CPU 0. This results in ACPI control code not being executed which could lead to unexpected behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiQueueWorkFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Support for the 64 bit ACPI AML timer operand is not implemented, this will be emulated and may affect AML code that relies on accurate timers.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGetTimerNotImplemented

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to install an ACPI SCI interrupt handler because the the IRQ allocation failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSciIrqAllocError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to install an ACPI SCI interrupt handler because the Global System Interrupt (GSI) is not registered.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSciGsiError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Cannot map an ACPI physical address above the 32 bit 4GB limit, this could lead to broken functionality.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMap4GbLimit

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI ACPI20 or ACPI RSDP pointers were invalid, so the kernel cannot find any of the ACPI tables.  ACPI support will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEfiRsdpError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Vendor .* System .* Revision .* has a known ACPI BIOS problem
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel has recognised that this particular version of the firmware has known ACPI issues and so ACPI support will be disabled. Reduced functionality will occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBlackListed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unable to register for device notifications
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI device notify handlers failed to be installed and so ACPI support with be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNotifyHandlerInstallFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI objects failed to initialize and so ACPI support with be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjectsFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unable to start the ACPI Interpreter
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter failed to start up correctly and so ACPI support with be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInterpreterFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI subsystem failed to be enabled and so ACPI support with be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEnableFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unable to load the System Description Tables
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was unabled to load the ACPI tables and so ACPI support will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiLoadFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unable to initialize the ACPI Interpreter
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter could not be intialized and so ACPI support will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel count not reallocate the ACPI tables into memory from firmware and so ACPI support will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiReallocateFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _SEG ACPI control could not be evaluated. This will stop certain PCI root bridges from being added and enabled on the computer.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSegFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _BBN ACPI control could not be evaluated. This will stop certain PCI root bridges from being added and enabled on the computer.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSegFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Bus .*:.* not present in PCI namespace
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The bus cound not be found in the PCI namespace. This will stop certain PCI root bridges from being added and enabled on the computer.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciScanFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI control _DSW (Device Sleep Wake) failed to execute, this may impact on the ability to enable or disable the wake capabilities of a device in the computer.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDswFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI control _PSW (Power State Wake) failed to execute, this may impact on the ability to enable or disable the wake capabilities of a device in the computer.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPswFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to power on or shutdown a wakeup device using _PSW or _DSW control methods.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSuspend

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Fail in evaluating the _REG object of EC device
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _REG object for the Embedded Controller Device could not be evaluated, however the kernel will ignore this and try to install the handler for the Embedded Controller.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEcBadReg

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An undock event was requested but the machine still seems to be docked.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDockCannotUndock

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A dock notify event was handled but the machine still seems to be undocked.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDockCannotDoct

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A dock notify event was handled, but the type of notify event was not recognised.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDockEvent

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred when trying to add a new dock station device.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDockAdd

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: More than one Lid device found
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to add a Lid device because one already exists.  The kernel does not support more than one Lid device.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiLidMany

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Lid Hardware ID (HID) is one that the kernel does not recognise and so the Lid device was not added to the system. This can explain why the Lid does not work.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiLidBadHid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel count not add a container because the device associated with this was NULL, which is unexexpected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiContainer

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI suspend wakeup header did not contain the expected header value so the kernel had to abort the suspend. This can happen if the data is corrupted.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSuspendHeader

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: _CST returned either a NULL buffer or a type that wasn't an ACPI package or less than 2 elements in the package. The kernel could not evaluate the CPU supported C states supported, meaning that the machine will not run optimally.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCstElements

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI: count given by _CST is not valid
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: _CST returned an invalid number of elements, the package a different number of C states to the number of C states that _CST reported. The kernel could not evaluate the CPU supported C states supported, meaning that the machine will not run optimally.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCstCount

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI evaluate for a reference returned a buffer of zero length or a NULL buffer pointer.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEvalReferenceBadBuffer

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI evaluate for a reference did not return a ACPI package as expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEvalReferenceNotPackage

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI evaluate for a reference returned an illeage package of zero elements.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEvalReferencePackageZeroElements

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Expecting a [Reference] package element, found type
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI evaluate for a reference returned contained an element that was not a reference type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEvalReferencePackageElementType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Embedded Controller Offset Query Control Method _EC failed to evaluate. It is either missing or broken and means the kernel cound not add a SMBUS host controller.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEcFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel count not issue a SMBUS transaction because the host controller was not configured. See acpi_smbus_transaction()
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogSmbusHostController

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel could not register a thermal zone because acpi_attach_data() failed for some reason. The machine may not be able to optimally cool itself and may have overheating issues because of this error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiThermZoneAttachFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _TSS has returned a zero fequency setting in one or more of the package elements.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTssZeroFrequency

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _TSS has returned a NULL data pointer or data which isn't an ACPI package.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTssBadData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The number of entries in the throlling domain information was not 5.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTsdIllegalNumEntries

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The expected TSD revision was not 0.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTsdBadRevision

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The CPU does not seem to support the MSR_IA32_THERM_CONTROL MSR.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnsupportedThermControlMsr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Could not read the hardware specific throttling status, the status register space ID was not a system I/O space or a fixed hardware space.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiThrottleStatusBadRead

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _TSD has returned data which isn't valid, either a NULL data pointer or data which isn't an ACPI package has been returned.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTsdBadData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _PTC control register bit widths or bit offsets are incorrect.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPtcControlRegisterInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _PTC status register bit widths or bit offsets are incorrect.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPtcStatusRegisterInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _PTC status register data (element 1 of the package) was either NULL or too small.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPtcDataStatusRegister

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _PTC control register data (element 0 of the package) was either NULL or too small.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPtcDataControlRegister

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: _PTC did not return a package of two elements, expected a two element package containing bufffers for the control and status register.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPtcDataBad

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: sysfs_create_link() failed to create the thermal 'thermal_cooling' sysfs entry.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiThermalThermalCoolingSysfs

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: sysfs_create_link() failed to create the thermal 'device' sysfs entry.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiThemalDeviceSysfs

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The call to acpi_bus_update_power() in acpi_fan_add() failed while adding a new fan device.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFanAddFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI:.*EC.*input buffer is not empty, aborting transaction
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Embedded Controller (EC) driver attempted to perform a read or write transaction but had to abort because the EC was still busy and the input buffer was not emptied within 500ms.  Normally this indicates an EC firmware fault.  One can try increasing the delay using the acpi.ec_delay kernel parameter or writing to /sys/module/acpi/parameters/ec_delay - however this generally does not help much of the EC firmware is buggy.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEcInputBufferIsNotEmpty

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The MSR_IA32_ENERGY_PERF_BIAS was initialized incorrectly and was defaulted to a high performance bias setting.  The kernel has detected this and changed it down to a 'normal' bias setting.  The BIOS vendor should be informed that the MSR is not defaulted to the normal bias setting.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEnergyPerfBiasSetToNormal

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _CRS object could not be evaluated because an invalid resource type has been returned. This can lead to misconfigured PNP hardware and may render a system unbootable.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPnpCrsInvalidResourceType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _CRS object could not be evaluated, the error code is an ACPI error return code (see include/acpi/acexecp.h in the linux source, this is composed of bottom 12 bits of an error number and upper 4 bits of an AE_CODE_* code. Typically, _CRS evaluation errors can lead to misconfigured PNP hardware and may render a system unbootable.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPnpCrsCannotEvaluate

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Dell WMI driver has received an unknown WMI event. The driver should handle this new event or the firmware is reporting an incorrect and unknown event.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogDellWmiReceivedUnknownWMIEvent

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Dell WMI driver has received a bad event status. This should be investigated further.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogDellWmiBadEventStatus

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ASUS WMI driver has received an unknown key event. The driver should handle this new key event or the firmware is reporting an incorrect and unknown event.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAsusWmiUnknownKeypressed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The HP WMI driver has received a bad event status. This should be investigated further.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogHpWmiBadEventStatus

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: sysfs_create_link() failed to create the thermal 'thermal_cooling' sysfs entry.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiThermalThermalCoolingSysfs

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: sysfs_create_link() failed to create the thermal 'device' sysfs entry.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiThemalDeviceSysfs

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI:.*EC.*input buffer is not empty, aborting transaction
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Embedded Controller (EC) driver attempted to perform a read or write transaction but had to abort because the EC was still busy and the input buffer was not emptied within 500ms.  Normally this indicates an EC firmware fault.  One can try increasing the delay using the acpi.ec_delay kernel parameter or writing to /sys/module/acpi/parameters/ec_delay - however this generally does not help much of the EC firmware is buggy.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEcInputBufferIsNotEmpty

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: This is not exactly a failure but a warning from the kernel. The MSR_IA32_ENERGY_PERF_BIAS was initialized and defaulted to a high performance bias setting. The kernel has detected this and changed it down to a 'normal' bias setting.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEnergyPerfBiasSetToNormal

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _CRS object could not be evaluated because an invalid resource type has been returned. This can lead to misconfigured PNP hardware and may render a system unbootable.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPnpCrsInvalidResourceType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _CRS object could not be evaluated, the error code is an ACPI error return code (see include/acpi/acexecp.h in the linux source, this is composed of bottom 12 bits of an error number and upper 4 bits of an AE_CODE_* code. Typically, _CRS evaluation errors can lead to misconfigured PNP hardware and may render a system unbootable.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPnpCrsCannotEvaluate

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Dell WMI driver has received an unknown WMI event. The driver should handle this new event or the firmware is reporting an incorrect and unknown event.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogDellWmiReceivedUnknownWMIEvent

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Dell WMI driver has received a bad event status. This should be investigated further.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogDellWmiBadEventStatus

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ASUS WMI driver has received an unknown key event. The driver should handle this new key event or the firmware is reporting an incorrect and unknown event.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAsusWmiUnknownKeypressed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The HP WMI driver has received a bad event status. This should be investigated further.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogHpWmiBadEventStatus

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The HP WMI driver has received a return object that was not of type ACPI_BUFFER. The driver needs to be updated to handle this new return type or there is a bug in the WMI mechanism on this machine.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogHpWmiUnknownResponseReceived

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The HP WMI driver has received a return buffer that was not the expected size of 8 or 16 bytes. This is probably a bug in the WMI mechanism on this machine.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogHpWmiUnknownBufferLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The HP WMI driver has received a key code that it does not recognise. The driver needs to be updated to handle this new key code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogHpWmiUnknownKeyCode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The HP WMI driver has received an event ID that it does not recognise. The driver needs to be updated to handle this new event ID.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogHpWmiUnknownEventId

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The MSI WMI driver has received a key code that it does not recognise. The driver needs to be updated to handle this new key code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogMsiWmiUnknownKeyPressed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: BIOS has a garbled _PRT entry; source_name and source_index swapped.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHandlingGarbledPrtEntry

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI _PCT data is invalid.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogInvalidPctData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Error.*ACPI path has too many parent prefixes
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A path to an ACPI obejct has too many ^ parent prefixes and references passed the top of the root node. Please check AML for all ^ prefixed ACPI path names.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPathTooManyParentPrefixes

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Error.*A valid RSDP was not found
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI-compatible system must provide an RSDP (Root System Description Pointer in the system's low address space. This structure’s only purpose is to provide the physical address of the RSDT and XSDT.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiValidRsdpNotFound

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Attempted to release of a Mutex that was not previous acquired. This needs fixing as it could lead to race conditions when operating on a resource that needs to be proteced by a Mutex.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCannotReleaseMutex

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Section 6.2.10.2 of V4.0a of the ACPI specification states that the _OSC Method should be passed an 8 byte buffer of 2 x 32 DWORDs, however it appears that the method is possibly trying to access data outside this buffer. This is a bug in the _OSC method.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSbOscAeAmlBufferLimit

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _OSC method evaluation failed, which will result in disabling PCIe functionality, for example, the Linux kernel has to disable Active State Power Management (ASPM) which means that PCIe power management is not optimally configured.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPciAcpiOscRequestFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _OSC method indicates it has been passed an invalid UUID, see section 6.2.10 _OSC (Operating System Capabilities) of the ACPI specification for more details.  Note that it has been observed on some systems that this error is returned because the _OSC has evaluated incorrectly and it returns with an incorrect error setting the OSC invalid UUID error bit.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogOscInvalidUuid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _OSC method indicates it has been passed an invalid revision number, see section 6.2.10 _OSC (Operating System Capabilities) of the ACPI specification for more details.  Note that the revision level is specific to the given UUID.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogOscInvalidRevision

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _OSC method evaluation failed for some unknown reason. This could be that the data passed to it was incorrect or that the method itself is broken. See section 6.2.10 _OSC (Operating System Capabilities) of the ACPI specification for more details.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogOscRequestFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _OSC method evaluation failed for some unknown reason. This could be that the data passed to it was incorrect or that the method itself is broken. See section 6.2.10 _OSC (Operating System Capabilities) of the ACPI specification for more details.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogOscRequestFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The field exceeds the allocated buffer size. This can lead to unexpected results when fetching data outside this region.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFieldexceedsBuffer

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Error.*Illegal I/O port address/length above 64K
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A port address or length has exceeded the maximum allowed 64K address limit. This will lead to unpredicable errors.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIllegalIOAbove64K

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI Method has returned an unexpected and incorrect return type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIncorrectReturnType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI Method has returned an Integer type when a Buffer, String or Package was expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNeededBufferOrStringOrPackage

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI Method has returned an Device type when a Reference type was expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNeededReference

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Method did not return a value and was expected too. This is a bug and needs fixing.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMissingExpectedReturnValue

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A Method has returned a Package List that was larger than expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPackageListLargerThanExpected

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An illegal AML opcode has been found and is ignored. This indicates either badly compiled code or opcode corruption in the DSDT or SSDT tables or a bug in the ACPI execution engine. Recommend disassembing using iasl to find any offending code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFoundUnknownOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Warning.*Detected an unsupported executable opcode
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An illegal AML opcode has been found and is ignored. This indicates either badly compiled code or opcode corruption in the DSDT or SSDT tables or a bug in the ACPI execution engine. Recommend disassembing using iasl to find any offending code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDetectedUnsupportedOpCode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS has found a BIOS32 Service Directory but the BIOS has returned error 0x80 on calling the service, which indicates that the requested service has not been implemented in the firmware.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBios32ServiceNotPresent

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS has found a BIOS32 Service Directory but the BIOS has returned an error on calling the service, which is unexpected and usually means the firmware is broken.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBios32ServiceBiosBug

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PCI: Error.*when fetching IRQ routing table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS has been interrogated for the PCI IRQ routing table but the BIOS returned an error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPciFetchingIRQRoutingTable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Error.*Denied AML access to port
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: AML code was accessing an I/O port that was banned from accesses. Ports 0x20-0x21 (PIC0), 0xa0-0xa1 (PIC1), 0x4d0-0x4d1 (ELCR) are always banned. For _OSI() greater or equal to 'Windows 2001' (Windows XP) ports 0x00-0x0f (DMA), 0x40-0x43 (PIT1), 0x48-0x4b (PIT2), 0x70-0x71 (RTC), 0x81-0x83 (DMA1), 0x87 (DMA1L), 0x89-0x8b (DMA2), 0x8f (DMA2L), 0x90-0x91 (ARBC), 0x93-0x94 (SETUP), 0x96-0x97 (POS), 0xc0-0xdf (ISA DMA) and 0xcf8-0xcff (PCI config) are banned.  Since the AML code has been banned from accessing these ports you will get undefined behaviour and the AML code should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDeniedAmlAccessToPort

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Method was expected to return a value and did not.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMethodNoReturnValue

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Method returned a table of the incorrect length. This can lead to unexepected results.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidTableLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Method failed: ResourceSourceIndex is present but ResourceSource is not.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBufferLimit

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Method failed to allocate owner ID.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOwnerIdLimit

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A Mutex acquire failed, which could possibly indicate that it was previously acquired and not released, or a race has occurred. Some AML code fails to miss Mutex acquire failures, so it is a good idea to verify all Mutex Acquires using the syntaxcheck test.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMutexNotAcquired

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Error.*SMBus or IPMI write requires Buffer of
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An incorrect SMBus or IPMI write buffer size was used.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIncorrectWriteBufferSize

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Executing the ACPI Method leaded in an execution failure. This needs investigating.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEvaluationFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Warning.*Optional field.*has zero address or length
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI table contains Generic Address Structure that has an address that is incorrectly set to zero, or a zero length. This needs to be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOptionalFieldZeroAddressOrLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The FADT table contains a mismatch between the 32 bit pointer (DSDT) and 64 bit pointer (X_DSDT) pointer to the FACS table.  Section 5.2.9 of version 4.0a of the ACPI specification states that X_DSDT should be zero if DSDT is defined, or DSDT should be zero if X_DSDT is zero. With two different pointers defined, the kernel has to make a choice, and opts for the 32 bit pointer. Because these pointers are different, it suggests either one of them is incorrect, or different 32 bit and 64 bit DSDT tables are present in your system, which is NOT complaint with the ACPI specification.  The kernel has to make a choice and opts for the 32 bit DSDT.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTwoDsdt

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The FADT table contains a mismatch between the 32 bit pointer (FIRMWARE_CTRL) and 64 bit pointer (X_FIRMWARE_CTRL) pointer to the FACS table.  Section 5.2.9 of version 4.0a of the ACPI specification states that X_FIRMWARE_CTRL should be zero if FIRMWARE_CTRL is defined, or FIRMWARE_CTRL should be zero if X_FIRMWARE_CTRL is zero. With two different pointers defined, the kernel has to make a choice, and opts for the 32 bit pointer. Because these pointers are different, it suggests either one of them is incorrect, or different 32 bit and 64 bit FACS tables are present in your system, which is NOT complaint with the ACPI specification.  The kernel has to make a choice and opts for the 32 bit FIRMWARE_CTRL.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTwoFacs

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Error.*32/64X address mismatch in.*, using 32
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The FADT table contains a mismatch between a 32 bit pointer and a 64 bit Generic Address pointer. Because these pointers are different, it suggests either one of them is incorrect.  If a non-null 32 bit pointer exists, then the kernel will opt for this in preference to the 64 bit pointer even though this is not in accordance to the ACPI specification.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpi32Bit64BitAddressMismatch

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The FADT table contains Generic Address Structure that has a mismatch between the 32 bit and 64 bit versions of an address. This should be fixed so there are no mismatches.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpi32Bit64BitAddressMismatchInFadt

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A table contains Generic Address Structure that has a mismatch between the 32 bit and 64 bit versions of an address. This should be fixed so there are no mismatches.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpi32Bit64BitAddressMismatch

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI AML interpreter executed a Method that returned a package with incorrectly typed data. The offending method needs to be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiReturnPackageTypeMismatch

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Warning.*Return Package has no elements
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI AML interpreter executed a Method that returned a package with no elements inside it. This is most probably a bug in the Method and needs to be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiReturnPackageZeroElements

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Warning.*Return Package is too small
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI AML interpreter executed a Method that returned a package with too few elements inside it. This is most probably a bug in the Method and needs to be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiReturnPackageTooSmall

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI table listed above has an incorrect checksum, this could be a BIOS bug or due to table corruption.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIncorrectTableChecksum

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Warning.*_BQC returned an invalid level
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Method _BQC (Brightness Query Current) returned an invalid display brightness level.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBqcReturnedInvalidLevel

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Warning.*Could not enable fixed event
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCannotEnableFixedEvent

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Method returned an incorrect type, this should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiReturnTypeMismatch

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Method was executing with a different number of parameters than the Method expected. This should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiParameterCountMistmatch

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Method has not enough arguments as expected. This should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInsufficientArguments

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Method returned a package with no elements in it, and some were exepected.This should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPackageHasNoElements

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Warning.*Converted Buffer to expected String
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Method returned a Buffer type instead of a String type and ACPI driver automatically converted it to a String.  It is worth fixing this in the DSDT or SSDT even if the kernel fixes it at run time.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiConvertedBufferToString

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Warning.*Return Package type mistmatch at index
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Method returned a package that contained data of the incorrect data type. This data type needs fixing.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiReturnPackageTypeMismatch

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: This item in the FADT is the incorrect length. Should be corrected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFadtInvalidLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: This is most probably caused by when a read or write operation to the EC memory has failed because of a timeout waiting for the Embedded Controller to complete the transaction.  Normally, the kernel waits for 500ms for the Embedded Controller status port to indicate that a transaction is complete, but in this case it has not and a AE_TIME error has been returned.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTimeOutReturnedByHandler

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI AML intepreter has found some non-conforming AML code. This should be investigated and fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadAmlCode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI.*BIOS bug: multiple APIC/MADT found, using
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel has detected more than one ACPI Multiple APIC Description Table (MADT) (these tables have the "APIC" signature). There should only be one MADT and the kernel will by default select the first one. However, one can override this and select the Nth MADT using acpi_apic_instance=N.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMultipleApicMadtFound

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \[Firmware Bug\]: ACPI.*Invalid physical address in GAR
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI Generic Address is invalid
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidPhysicalAddress

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \[Firmware Bug\]: powernow-k8.*(No PSB or ACPI _PSS objects|No compatible ACPI _PSS|Your BIOS does not provide ACPI _PSS objects)
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The _PSS object (Performance Supported States) is an optional object that indicates the number of supported processor performance states. The powernow-k8 driver source states: If you see this message, complain to BIOS manufacturer. If he tells you "we do not support Linux" or some similar nonsense, remember that Windows 2000 uses the same legacy mechanism that the old Linux PSB driver uses. Tell them it is broken with Windows 2000. The reference to the AMD documentation is chapter 9 in the BIOS and Kernel Developer's Guide, which is available on www.amd.com.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmdK8ExpectedPssObjects

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \[Firmware Bug\]: ACPI.*Invalid bit width in GAR
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI Generic Address width must be 8, 16, 32 or 64
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGarInvalidBitWidth

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \[Firmware Bug\]: ACPI.*Invalid address space type in GAR
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI Generic Address space type must be system memory or system IO space.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGarInvalidAddressType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \[Firmware Bug\]: ACPI.*no secondary bus range in _CRS
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: _CRS Method should return a secondary bus address for the status/command port. The kernel is having to guess this based on the _BBN or assume it's 0x00-0xff.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCrsSecondaryBusRangeMissing

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: _PSS (Performance Supported States) package has an incorrectly define core frequency (first DWORD entry in the _PSS package).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidPssFrequency

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: _BQC (Brightness Query Current level) seems to be missing. This method returns the current brightness level of a built-in display output device.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMissingBqc

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: _BQC (Brightness Query Current level) seems to be missing. This method returns the current brightness level of a built-in display output device.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMissingBqc

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \[Firmware Bug\]: BIOS needs update for CPU frequency support
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Having _PPC but missing frequencies (_PSS, _PCT) is a good hint that the BIOS is older than the CPU and does not know the CPU frequencies.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMissingPssPct

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Error Record Serialization Table (ERST) seems to be invalid. This normally indicates that the ERST table header size is too small, or the table size (excluding header) is not a multiple of the ERST entries.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiErstInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI _CRT (Critical Trip Point) is returning a threshold lower than zero degrees Celsius which is clearly incorrect.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCrtInvalidThreshold

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: No valid ACPI _CRT (Critical Trip Point) was found.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNoValidCrt

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI Method _BCQ was defined (typo) instead of _BQC - this should be fixed.however the kernel has detected this and is working around this typo.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBcqInsteadOfBqc

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The MultiProcessor table has an incorrect signature, it should be PCMP. The kernel cannot trust the table and has disabled SMP support.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMptableBadSignature

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The MultiProcessor table has an incorrect checksum. The kernel cannot trust the table and has disabled SMP support.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMptableChecksumError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The MultiProcessor table has an incorrect version. It should be 0x01 or 0x04 (for versions 1.1 and 1.4 respectively). The kernel cannot trust the table and has disabled SMP support.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMptableBadVersion

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The MultiProcessor table contains a NULL Local APIC address but the Local APIC address must be defined. The kernel has disabled SMP support.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMptableNullLapicAddress

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The MultiProcessor table contains no Processor Entry Fields, and hence there are no CPUs defined. The kernel has no option but to disable SMP support.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMptableNoProcessors

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: BIOS bug.*no explicit IRQ entries.*using default mptable
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The MultiProcessor table contains no IRQ Entry Fields, and hence there are no IRQs defined. The table is broken and should be fixed. The kernel will set up the low 16 IO-APIC pins to the ISA defaults in the hope the machine may work.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMptableNoIRQentries

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: BIOS bug.*timer not connected to IO-APIC
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS is reporting the ExtINTA I/O APIC input from the cascaded 8259A as the timer interrupt input.  The kernel has detected just one pin, so it has to check the timer directly and through the 8259A because of the broken BIOS reporting.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosTimerNotConnectedtoIoApic

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: BIOS bug,.*IO-APIC.*ID is.*in the MPC table.*
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The IO-APIC id in the MPC table is wrong and the kernel has detected this and attempted to fix it. The MPC table in the firmware needs to be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosIoApicInMpcTable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The IO-APIC id has been defined more than once in the MPC table, which is a firmware bug and should be fixed. The kernel has detected this and skopped this duplication to avoid stuck on smp_invalidate_needed IPI wait' messages.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosIoApicIdAlreadyUsed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: WARNING.*BIOS bug.*CPU MTRRs don't cover all of memory, losing
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) which define memory caching policy are misconfigued by the BIOS and don't appear to cover all available physical memory. The kernel has detected this and has reduced the amount of memory available to be safe. Either check that the BIOS memory caching options are set correctly or contact your BIOS vendor to get this fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosCpuMtrrMisconfigured

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A device driver has tried to allocate a Memory Type Range Register (MTRR) to optimially configure a caching policy on a memory region but there are no more free MTRRs available.  Generally the firmware should allow for one or two free MTRRs for drivers to allocate.  The system will have a sub-optimally configured memory region and this may severely impact on performance.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosNoMoreMtrrsAvailable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The DRM driver has tried to allocate a Memory Type Range Register (MTRR) but there are no more free MTRRs available. The system will have a sub-optimally configured graphics memory region and this may severely impact on graphics rendering throughput and performance.  The firmware should allow for one or two free MTRRs, but it hasn't, which is probably a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrAllocationFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*your BIOS has configured an incorrect mask, fixing it
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) which define memory caching policy are misconfigued by the BIOS. In this case, the mask is incorrectly set and the kernel has detected this and worked around the firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrIncorrectMask

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*your CPUs had inconsistent fixed MTRR settings
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The fixed Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) which define memory caching policy are not consistent across all CPUs which is a firmware bug. The kernel has worked around this bug, but it may be worth getting the BIOS vendor to fix this.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrsInconsistentAcrossCPUs

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*your CPUs had inconsistent variable MTRR settings
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The variable Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) which define memory caching policy are not consistent across all CPUs which is a firmware bug. The kernel has worked around this bug, but it may be worth getting the BIOS vendor to fix this.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrsInconsistentAcrossCPUs

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*your CPUs had inconsistent MTRRdefType settings
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) which define memory caching policy do not have a MTRRdefType consistently set across all CPUs which is a firmware bug. The kernel has worked around this bug, but it may be worth getting the BIOS vendor to fix this.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrDefTypeIncosistent

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) for Intel PPro CPUs with stepping < 8 must be 4 MiB aligned and not touch 0x70000000 -> 0x7003FFFF. This BIOS misconfiguration and should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrNot4MbAligned

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*writable mtrr between 0x70000000 and 0x7003FFFF may hang the CPU
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) for Intel PPro CPUs with stepping < 8 must not touch region 0x70000000 -> 0x7003FFFF. This BIOS misconfiguration may hang the CPU and should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrMayHangCPU

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*base.*is not aligned on a size.*boundary
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) must be correctly aligned. This BIOS misconfiguration and should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrNotAlignedCorrectly

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI Method _DOD (Enumerate all devices attached to display adapter) is defined but we should also have _DOS (Enable/Disable output switching) defined but it's been omitted. This can cause display switching issues.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDodWithNoDos

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: WARNING:.*bogus zero IO-APIC address found in MPTABLE
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An IO-APIC address of zero has been found in the MPTABLE and is thus treated as misconfigured or bogus. I/O APIC support has been disabled. This is considered a firmware bug and the MPTABLE needs to be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBogusIoApicInMptable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An IO-APIC address of zero has been found in the MPTABLE and is thus treated as misconfigured or bogus. I/O APIC support has been disabled. This is considered a firmware bug and the MPTABLE needs to be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBogusIoApicInMptable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Try video module parameter video.allow_duplicates=1 if the current driver does't work.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDuplicateAcpiVideoBus

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \[Firmware Bug\]:.*PCI.*MMCONFIG.*not reserved in ACPI motherboard resources
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: It appears that PCI config space has been configured for a specific device but does not appear to be reserved by the ACPI motherboard resources.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMmconfigNotReserved

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \[Firmware Bug\]: PCI.*not reserved in ACPI motherboard resources
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: PCI firmware bug. Please see the kernel log for more details.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPciNotReserved

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: This is not exactly a failure mode but a warning from the kernel. The _OSI() method has implemented a match to the 'Linux' query in the DSDT and this is redundant because the ACPI driver matches onto the Windows _OSI strings by default.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOsiLinuxIgnored

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI driver has detected an ACPI bug. This generally points to a bug in an ACPI table. Examine the kernel log for more details.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFirmwareError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel has detected a Firmware bug in the BIOS or ACPI which needs investigating and fixing.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFirmwareError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel has detected an error trying to execute an Method and it cannot find an object. This is indicates a bug in the DSDT or SSDT AML code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNamespaceLookupFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI engine has failed to execute some AML. The error message above lists the method that caused this error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiParseOrExecFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel has most probably detected an error while executing ACPI AML. The error lists the ACPI driver module and the line number where the bug has been caught and the method that caused the error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiExecFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Execution of an ACPI AML method failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiExecFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI method reached maximum reentrancy limit of 255 - infinite recursion in AML in DSTD or SSDT
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRecursionTooDeep

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \*\*\* Error.*Method reached maximum reentrancy limitACPI method has reached reentrancy limit, this is a recursion bug in the AML
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRecursionTooDeep
